constants.name: pyrolysis temperature
evidence_sentences: All experiments were conducted at a pyrolysis temperature of 500 °C.

constants.name: heating rate
evidence_sentences: The heating rate was maintained at 10 °C/min throughout the experiments.

constants.name: nitrogen purge duration
evidence_sentences: A nitrogen purge of 30 minutes was applied before the start of each run to ensure an inert atmosphere.

constants.name: condenser temperature
evidence_sentences: The condenser temperature was kept at 40 °C to collect the liquid products.

constants.name: reactor pressure
evidence_sentences: The reactor was operated under atmospheric pressure.

outcome_groups.description: The total amount of liquid oil produced from the pyrolysis of the mixed feedstock at varying HDPE ratios.
evidence_sentences: The oil yield increased from 42.5 wt% for PPO111 to 53.2 wt% for PPO811.
The highest oil yield was observed in PPO811, reaching 53.2 wt%.

outcome_groups.description: The distribution of distillation fractions (petrol, diesel, residue) obtained from the pyrolysis oil at varying HDPE ratios.
evidence_sentences: The petrol fraction ranged from 18.3 wt% (PPO111) to 26.7 wt% (PPO811), while the diesel fraction increased from 24.1 wt% (PPO111) to 33.4 wt% (PPO811).
The residue fraction decreased from 37.6 wt% (PPO111) to 23.1 wt% (PPO811).

outcome_groups.description: Key fuel properties of the pyrolysis oil including kinematic viscosity (KV), density, cetane index (CI), and higher heating value (HHV).
evidence_sentences: The kinematic viscosity (KV) at 40 °C ranged from 3.8 mm²/s (PPO111) to 4.6 mm²/s (PPO811).
The density of the oil varied from 870 kg/m³ (PPO111) to 895 kg/m³ (PPO811).
The cetane index (CI) decreased from 51.2 (PPO111) to 46.8 (PPO811).
The higher heating value (HHV) increased from 42.1 MJ/kg (PPO111) to 44.3 MJ/kg (PPO811).

outcome_groups.description: Concentrations of aromatic hydrocarbons and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons in the pyrolysis oil at varying HDPE ratios.
evidence_sentences: The total aromatic hydrocarbon (AH) content increased from 34.2 wt% (PPO111) to 47.8 wt% (PPO811).
The concentration of polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs) rose from 1.2 mg/kg (PPO111) to 3.8 mg/kg (PPO811).
